attributes.action: Fly the LGBT flag in Abingdon
attributes.additional_details: Abingdon is one of the only towns to not fly the LGBT flag. The Abingdon council have previously rejecteted the flag to be flown. Many young people have been abused and excluded due to their sexuality and gender, and we strongly believe this is unacceptable. This is very important to us and we would like our LGBT family and friends to be able to live in comfort without feeling threatened or ashamed of who they are. We would like to raise awareness and allow the flag to be up in our home town.
attributes.background: Myself and twelve other young people are on an NCS course, and we believe that the LGBT community do not have the support they need to thrive in safety. We are doing a fundraiser including a colour run and family day in our home town, Abingdon, to raise awareness.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a new petition about something the UK Parliament and Government are responsible for. For example, you could start a new petition asking the UK Government and Parliament to fund a campaign to raise awareness of LGBT issues, if that's something you'd like to happen.
